title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper sandhu jatt
description: A novel about the serious issues of rape and racial inequality in the American South, as seen through the eyes of a child.

author: George Orwell
description: A dystopian novel set in a totalitarian regime that practices extreme surveillance and control.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A story about the young and mysterious millionaire Jay Gatsby and his obsession with the beautiful former debutante Daisy Buchanan.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: A romantic novel that charts the emotional development of the protagonist Elizabeth Bennet.

title: Moby-Dick
author: Herman Melville
description: The narrative of Captain Ahab’s obsessive quest to seek revenge on the giant white whale Moby Dick.

title: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
description: A futuristic society that has eradicated pain and suffering at the cost of individual freedom.

title: The Lord of the Rings
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: An epic high-fantasy novel that follows the quest to destroy the One Ring and defeat the Dark Lord Sauron.

title: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
description: A philosophical novel about a young shepherd's journey to realize his Personal Legend.

title: War and Peace
author: Leo Tolstoy
description: A historical novel that chronicles the French invasion of Russia and the impact on Russian society.

title: Jane Eyre
author: Charlotte Brontë
description: The story of a young orphaned girl’s rise from an oppressed childhood to independence and self-respect.

title: Wuthering Heights
author: Emily Brontë
description: A tragic love story between Heathcliff and Catherine Earnshaw set on the Yorkshire moors.

title: The Odyssey
author: Homer
description: An epic poem following the adventures of Odysseus as he returns home from the Trojan War.

title: Don Quixote
author: Miguel de Cervantes
description: The story of a nobleman who sets out to revive chivalry, undo wrongs, and bring justice to the world.

title: The Divine Comedy
author: Dante Alighieri
description: An epic poem about Dante's journey through Hell, Purgatory, and Heaven, guided by Virgil and Beatrice.

title: The Brothers Karamazov
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
description: A philosophical novel revolving around the moral struggles and existential questions of a Russian family.

title: Crime and Punishment
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
description: The story of a young impoverished man who believes he is above the law, only to be consumed by guilt.

title: Anna Karenina
author: Leo Tolstoy
description: A novel that contrasts the life of a married woman, Anna, who embarks on a doomed affair.

title: Ulysses
author: James Joyce
description: A modernist novel chronicling the experiences of Leopold Bloom in Dublin during one ordinary day.

title: One Hundred Years of Solitude
author: Gabriel García Márquez
description: The multi-generational story of the Buendía family, blending magical realism and historical allegory.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: The adventures of Bilbo Baggins, a hobbit who embarks on a quest to reclaim treasure from a dragon.

title: The Catch-22
author: Joseph Heller
description: A satirical novel about the absurdities of war and bureaucracy, centered on a bomber pilot in World War II.

title: Les Misérables
author: Victor Hugo
description: A historical novel set in post-revolutionary France, telling the story of Jean Valjean and his quest for redemption.

title: Frankenstein
author: Mary Shelley
description: The tragic tale of Victor Frankenstein, a scientist who creates life only to be horrified by his creation.

title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
author: Oscar Wilde
description: The story of a man who remains eternally young while a portrait of him ages in his place, reflecting his moral decay.

title: The Grapes of Wrath
author: John Steinbeck
description: A powerful story about the plight of migrant farm workers during the Great Depression in America.

title: Dracula
author: Bram Stoker
description: A Gothic novel telling the story of Count Dracula's attempt to move from Transylvania to England.

title: Fahrenheit 451
author: Ray Bradbury
description: A dystopian novel about a future society where books are banned and 'firemen' burn them to suppress knowledge.

title: The Scarlet Letter
author: Nathaniel Hawthorne
description: A story set in 17th-century Puritan Massachusetts, about a woman punished for adultery.

title: The Metamorphosis
author: Franz Kafka
description: A novella about a man who wakes up one day to find himself transformed into a giant insect.

title: The Road
author: Cormac McCarthy
description: A post-apocalyptic novel following a father and son as they journey across a barren landscape.

title: Slaughterhouse-Five
author: Kurt Vonnegut
description: A satirical novel about the experiences of a soldier who becomes 'unstuck in time' after the firebombing of Dresden.

title: Lolita
author: Vladimir Nabokov
description: A controversial novel about an older man's obsession with a 12-year-old girl.

title: Heart of Darkness
author: Joseph Conrad
description: A novella about a voyage up the Congo River into the heart of Africa, examining colonialism and human nature.

title: Beloved
author: Toni Morrison
description: A novel about a woman haunted by the ghost of her dead daughter, exploring slavery and its aftermath.

title: Maus
author: Art Spiegelman
description: A graphic novel recounting the experiences of the author's father during the Holocaust, depicted with animals as characters.

title: Invisible Man
author: Ralph Ellison
description: A novel that addresses many of the social and intellectual issues faced by African Americans in the early 20th century.

title: The Sun Also Rises
author: Ernest Hemingway Sandhu
description: A novel about a group of expatriates in post-World War I Europe, capturing the disillusionment of the Lost Generation.

title: The Old Man and the Sea
author: Ernest Hemingway
description: The story of an aging fisherman who struggles with a giant marlin far out in the Gulf Stream.

title: Madame Bovary
author: Gustave Flaubert
description: A novel about a doctor's wife, Emma Bovary, who seeks to escape her provincial life through extravagant spending and affairs.

title: A Tale of Two Cities
author: Charles Dickens
description: A novel set in London and Paris before and during the French Revolution, telling the story of sacrifice and redemption.

title: Great Expectations
author: Charles Dickens
description: The coming-of-age story of an orphan named Pip, exploring themes of wealth and personal development.

title: David Copperfield
author: Charles Dickens
description: A semi-autobiographical novel that follows the life of David Copperfield from childhood to maturity.

title: Middlemarch
author: George Eliot
description: A novel set in a provincial town, exploring the lives of the townspeople and their social, political, and personal concerns.

title: The Sound and the Fury
author: William Faulkner
description: A Southern Gothic novel that tells the decline of the Compson family, set in the American South.

title: Of Mice and Men
author: John Steinbeck
description: A novella about two displaced ranch workers during the Great Depression, and their dreams of a better life.

title: The Stranger
author: Albert Camus
description: A novel about an indifferent man who is drawn into a senseless murder in Algeria.

title: East of Eden
author: John Steinbeck
description: A story about the intertwined destinies of two families, set in the fertile farmlands of California.

title: A Passage to India
author: E.M. Forster
description: A novel about the tensions between the British and Indians in colonial India, centered on a controversial court case.

title: Siddhartha
author: Hermann Hesse
description: A spiritual novel that follows the journey of a young man in ancient India seeking enlightenment.

title: Think and Grow rich!
author: Napolean Hill
description:
"I thought Think and Grow Rich! was a classic and could never be improved. I was wrong. I am sure Dr. Hill would be greatly pleased to see how his work has been honored and enhanced by this outstanding new edition." -- Wally Amos, author and founder of Famous Amos Chocolate Chip Cookies

Unlike most versions of Napoleon Hill's famous book, this edition restores his masterpiece to its original form and intent. It includes essential material on how to thrive in challenging economic times that was taken out of later versions but is incredibly relevant today. This is the only edition of Think and Grow Rich! that is fully annotated and indexed, providing key details about Dr. Hill's life and times, his lifelong research, and the leaders of business and industry he studied to glean the invaluable principles of success you'll discover here
